summary: The steering wheel air bag deployed when parked and rear windows were going up and down by themselves. There was no impact.

THE VEHICLE IS USED AS A PLOW TRUCK ON PRIVATE PROPERTY(FARM). IT IS NOT REGISTERED OR INSURED.   GMC REFUSES TO TOW IT TO THE NEAREST DEALERSHIP FOR ITS AIRBAG RECALL. THEY ARE TELLING ME I HAVE TO PAY FOR THE TOW THERE AND BACK(18 MILES).   THEY HAVE SENT OUT EMAILS STATING THEY WILL GIVE ME A $50 GIFT CARD, ALSO THEY WILL GIVE ME A LOANER CAR.  I SHOULD NOT HAVE TO PAY FOR THERE BAD AIRBAG.  PLEASE HELP. THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME I. THIS MATTER.
CLUTCH PEDDLE BROKE OUT IN MAY 2019.  PLASTIC CLUTCH MASTER PUSHED OUT OF CLUTCH PEDDLE BECAUSE OF POOR DESIGN.  *TR

I HAD STARTED THE TRUCK, CONNECTED A LANDSCAPE TRAILER AND STARTED OUT OF THE YARD, I STOPPED IN THE DRIVEWAY TO CHECK THE SAFETY CHAINS. WHILE I WAS OUTSIDE THE VEHICLE I HEARD A BANG.  WHEN I GOT BACK IN THE TRUCK THE AIRBAG LIGHT WAS ON AND BOTH FRONT SEATBELTS WERE LOCKED.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 GMC SIERRA 2500. THE CONTACT NOTICED NUMEROUS CRACKS IN THE DASHBOARD AROUND THE PASSENGER SIDE AIR BAG AREA. LARRY STOVESAND BUICK GMC IN PADUCAH, KENTUCKY AND ROYAL OAKS CHEVROLET IN PADUCAH, KENTUCKY WERE MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE AND STATED THAT THERE WAS NO RECALL. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS APPROXIMATELY 103,000.

I OWN A 2007 GMC SIRREA 2500HD SLT TRUCK AND IT HAS CRACKS IN THE DASH BOARD.WHICH FROM MY RESEARCH THESE GM TRUCKS AND MORE HAVE A HISTORY OF CRACKING AND GM REFUSES TO CORRECT THE PROBLEM. IT WOULD BE GREAT IF GM WOULD ADMIT TO THIS PROBLEM AND FIX IT AT THEIR EXPENSE.THE TRUCK WAS JUST SITTING WHEN I NOTICED THE CRACKS. THE CRACKS ARE LOCATED ABOVE THE GAUGE PANEL AND ON THE CORNER OF THE PASSENGER AIRBAG.

BRAKE LINES FAILED ON MY 2007 GMC 2500 AND MY 2007 GMC 1500.   IT APPEARS TO BE A COMMON PROBLEM WITH GMC VEHICLES FROM 2003 TO 2009. WHY WASN'T THESE VEHICLES RECALLED FOR THIS. I WAS TOLD THAT GMC WAS OFFERING A DISCOUNTED PRICE FOR FAILED BRAKE LINES, BUT THE DEALER CHARGED ME FULL PRICE. $1,667.00. THE DISCOUNTED PRICE WAS SUPPOSED TO BE $500.00.

MY TRUCK HAS A DEFECTIVE DASH THAT HAS CRACKED IN MULTIPLE PLACES FOR NO REASON AND NO ROUGH TREATMENT OR ANYTHIG THAT WOULD CAUSE IT TO BREAK, IT CRACKED AND BROKE ALL ON ITS OWN... AND GMC SHOULD BE RESPONSIBLE FOR REPLACING BECAUSE IT IS A SAFETY HAZARD. THIS IS A DEFECT HAPPENING TO THOUSANDS OF THESE TRUCKS AND ALL THE CRACKS AND BREAKS AND IN THE SAME EXACT SPOTS WHICH WOULD SEEM TO BE A MANUFACTURER DEFECT NOT A CONSUMER ISSUE...IF I WERE TO GET INTO AN ACCIDENT THE DEFECTIVE BROKEN DASH COULD SERIOUSLY INJURE SOMEONE. MY TRUCK IS ALSO PART OF THE TAKATA RECALL AND I CAN NOT GO IN TO GET THE AIR BAG FIXED BECAUSE IT WILL FURTHER BREAK MY DASH. THIS DASH ISSUE IS A MAJOR SAFETY ISSUE THAT NEEDS TO BE ADDRESSED AND A RECALL NEEDS TO BE MADE FOR THIS ISSUE

AUGUST 19, 2016 TRUCK WAS IN AN ACCIDENT WHEN THE VEHICLE WENT OUT OF CONTROL..  A BRACKET ON THE LEFT FRONT OF THE TRUCK BROKE AND THERE APPEARED TO BE A CRACK ON IT.  WE BELIEVE THE ACCIDENT WAS CAUSED BY THE BRACKET BRAKING AND THEN MADE IT SO THAT WE COULD NOT CONTROL THE VEHICLE

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 GMC SIERRA 2500. WHILE DRIVING 55 MPH, THE SEAT BELT INDEPENDENTLY UNBUCKLED. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE FAILURE RECURRED INTERMITTENTLY ON SEVERAL OCCASIONS. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT DIAGNOSED OR REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED. THE CONTACT WAS PROVIDED GM CASE NUMBER: 8-293255-7588. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 90,000.

THE DASH OF MY 2007 GMC 2500HD PICKUP TRUCK HAS CRACKED IN SEVERAL PLACES INCLUDING AROUND THE PASSENGER SIDE AIRBAG, UP AND OVER THE INSTRUMENT CLUSTER HUMP, AND IN THE MIDDLE OF THE DASH.  THESE CRACKS HAVE EXPANDED OVER THE PAST YEAR AND HAVE BECOME QUITE LARGE.  I AM CONCERNED THAT THE CRACKS AT THE AIRBAG COVER MAY IMPEDE THE PROPER FUNCTION OF THE AIRBAG SYSTEM AS WELL.  THIS SEEMS TO BE AN ONGOING PROBLEM WITH MANY GMC TRUCK OWNERS WITH MODEL YEARS 2007 - 2011 AND MY TRUCK DISPLAYS CRACKING VERY SIMILAR TO OTHERS POSTED TO WEBSITES ON THE INTERNET.

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 GMC SIERRA 2500. THE CONTACT RECEIVED A RECALL NOTICE REGARDING THE AIR BAGS AND WAS REPAIRED. IN ADDITION, THE AIR BAG WARNING INDICATOR ILLUMINATED. THE CONTACT TOOK THE VEHICLE TO THE DEALER, BUT THE FAILURE COULD NOT BE DIAGNOSED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED AND THE FAILURE RECURRED. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOT MADE AWARE OF THE FAILURE. THE APPROXIMATE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 55,000.
TAKATA RECALL.  NOTICE SENT OUT JULY 2015.  NO CORRECTIVE ACTION AVAILABLE.  REPAIR PLAN SHOULD BE IN PLACE AND ACTIVE.

TAKATA RECALL DEALER SENT RECALL LETTER IN 2015 WENT TO DEALER 3 TIMES OVER TIME, NO PARTS AVAILABLE. CALLED GMC GAVE THEM SAME INFO. THERE ANSWER THIS MESSAGE IS BEING RECORDED EXPLAINED WENT TO DEALER NO PARTS THERE REPLY TO ME BOTTOM LINE, DO NOT HAVE ANY PASSENGERS IN VEHICLE OR REPLACE PARTS AT MY EXPENSE. THIS IS UNEXCEPTABLE THEY HAVE PARTS FOR NEW VEHICLES BEING BUILT THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE FOR EVERY NEW CAR BUILT THEY SHOULD REPLACE ONE ON RECALL OR STOP PRODUCTION ON NEW VEHICLES. CHEAPER TO PAY DEATH OF PERSON THAN FIX PROBLEM.  THANK YOU

TL* THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 GMC SIERRA 2500. THE CONTACT RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 15V324000 (AIR BAGS); HOWEVER, THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE MANUFACTURER EXCEEDED A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME FOR THE RECALL REPAIR. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE ISSUE. THE CONTACT HAD NOT EXPERIENCED A FAILURE. VIN TOOL CONFIRMS PARTS NOT AVAILABLE.
THE DOOR HANDLES ARE PEELING THE FAKE CHROME AND IT IS RAZOR SHARP.  MY INTERIOR HANDLES HAVE CUT 3 PEOPLE TO DATE.
THE DASH AROUND THE AIRBAG IS CRACKED AND I'M CONCERNED ABOUT SHRAPNEL IF THE AIRBAG WERE TO DEPLOY.

THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE MANUFACTURER EXCEEDED A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME FOR THE RECALL REPAIR. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE ISSUE. THE CONTACT HAD NOT EXPERIENCED A FAILURE. TL* TAKATA RECALL. THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 GMC SIERRA 2500. AFTER THE VEHICLE WAS STARTED, THE AIR BAG WARNING INDICATOR ILLUMINATED. THE DEALER DIAGNOSED THAT UNKNOWN PARTS RELATED TO THE AIR BAG NEEDED TO BE REPLACED. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT REPAIRED. THE VIN WAS INCLUDED IN NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 15V324000 (AIR BAGS); HOWEVER, THE PARTS TO REPAIR THE VEHICLE WERE UNAVAILABLE. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED OF THE FAILURE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 100.

TL* TAKATA RECALL. THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 GMC SIERRA 2500. THE CONTACT RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 15V324000 (AIR BAGS); HOWEVER, THE PART TO DO THE REPAIR WAS UNAVAILABLE. THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE MANUFACTURER EXCEEDED A REASONABLE AMOUNT OF TIME FOR THE RECALL REPAIR. THE MANUFACTURER WAS MADE AWARE OF THE ISSUE. THE CONTACT HAD NOT EXPERIENCED A FAILURE. TAKATA RECALL. THERE IS AN OPEN RECALL ON THE VEHICLE'S PASSENGER SIDE AIRBAG. THE RECALL HAS BEEN ACTIVE FOR WELL OVER A YEAR AND REMAINS IN 'INCOMPLETE' STATUS. THIS RECALL IS NOT BEING ADDRESSED IN A TIMELY MANNER. GIVEN THE SEVERITY OF THE DAMAGE/INJURY/DEATH THAT CAN OCCUR AS A RESULT OF THE FAULTY AIRBAG, THIS DELAY IS UNACCEPTABLE. I HAVE CONTACTED THE GMC DEALERSHIP IN LIBERTY LAKE, WA, GEORGE GEE, AND THEY HAVE MERELY REITERATED THAT A FIX IS NOT YET AVAILABLE FOR RECALL. FURTHERMORE, I HAVE NEVER RECEIVED CORRESPONDENCE FROM THE MANUFACTURER NOTIFYING ME OF THE RECALL OR ITS STATUS.
TAKATA RECALL NEEDS TO BE COMPLETED AND CURRENTLY THERE IS NO REMEDY AVAILABLE.

TL* TAKATA RECALL. THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 GMC SIERRA 2500. THE CONTACT RECEIVED NOTIFICATION OF NHTSA CAMPAIGN NUMBER: 15V324000 (AIR BAGS) AND STATED THAT THE PART WAS NOT AVAILABLE WITHIN A REASONABLE TIME FRAME TO SCHEDULE THE RECALL REPAIR. THE DEALER DID NOT GIVE A SPECIFIC DATE FOR WHEN THE PART WOULD BECOME AVAILABLE. THE CONTACT WAS UNABLE TO DETERMINE WHEN THE VEHICLE WOULD BE REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER COULD NOT PROVIDE AN ESTIMATED DATE FOR WHEN THE CONTACT'S VEHICLE WOULD RECEIVE THE RECALL REPAIR. THE CONTACT WAS NOT EXPERIENCING A FAILURE. VIN TOOL CONFIRMS PARTS NOT AVAILABLE....UPDATED 03/08/17 *BF      *CN

THE PART WAS NOT AVAILABLE WITHIN A REASONABLE TIME FRAME TO SCHEDULE THE RECALL REPAIR. THE MANUFACTURER DID NOT GIVE A SPECIFIC DATE FOR WHEN THE REMEDY AND PARTS WOULD BECOME AVAILABLE. THE CONTACT WAS UNABLE TO DETERMINE WHEN THE VEHICLE WOULD BE REPAIRED. THE MANUFACTURER COULD NOT PROVIDE AN ESTIMATED DATE FOR WHEN THE CONTACT'S VEHICLE WOULD RECEIVE THE RECALL REPAIR. DASH IS CRACKING AROUND PASSENGER AIRBAG AND ABOVE INSTRUMENT CLUSTER. THE SAFETY CONCERN IS THAT DURING A WRECK WHAT WILL THE CRACKED DASH DO WHEN AIRBAGS ARE DEPLOYED. A RECALL SHOULD BE REQUIRED DUE TO DEFECTS IN DASH MANUFACTURING.

TAKATA RECALL:    I RECEIVED A SAFETY RECALL NOTICE IN JULY OF 2015 REGARDING THE FRONT PASSENGER AIRBAG INFLATOR.  RECALL #15438.  I HAVE HAD MY VEHICLE IN TO THE DEALER MULTIPLE TIMES AND AM STILL BEING TOLD THAT THERE IS "NO REMEDY" FOR THIS RECALL.  I AM CONCERNED FOR THE SAFETY AND WELL BEING OF THE VEHICLE OCCUPANTS SHOULD THIS VEHICLE BE INVOLVED IN AN ACCIDENT AND THE AIRBAGS DEPLOYED.  IT HAS BEEN OVER 17 MONTHS AND THIS SAFETY CONCERN IS EFFECTING MY USE OF THIS VEHICLE.  IT IS CURRENTLY MY ONLY VEHICLE AND IT IS IMPERATIVE THAT I BE ABLE TO UTILIZE IT ON A DAILY BASIS WITHOUT FEAR OF SERIOUS CONSEQUENCES SHOULD THERE BE AN ACCIDENT.  YESTERDAY THE DEALER ADVISED ME TO TURN OFF THE PASSENGER SIDE AIRBAG IF THERE IS A SWITCH ALLOWING ME TO DO THAT.  I BELIEVE THAT ACTION ALSO PUTS THE VEHICLE OCCUPANTS AT RISK AND IS NOT A SATISFACTORY REMEDY.

NHTSA RECALL NUMBER: OPENS NEW WINDOW TAKES AWAY FROM VIN LOOKUP SECTION>  15V324   RECALL DATE: MAY 28, 2015    MANUFACTURER RECALL NUMBER:  N150817.    SOME FRONT PASSENGER AIRBAG INFLATORS MAY EXPERIENCE AN ALTERATION OVER TIME, WHICH COULD LEAD TO OVERAGGRESSIVE COMBUSTION IN THE EVENT OF AN AIR BAG DEPLOYMENT. THIS CONDITION COULD CREATE EXCESSIVE INTERNAL PRESSURE WHEN THE AIR BAG IS DEPLOYED, WHICH COULD RESULT IN THE BODY OF THE INFLATOR RUPTURING UPON DEPLOYMENT.   SAFETY RISK:  IN THE EVENT OF AN INFLATOR RUPTURE, METAL FRAGMENTS COULD PASS THROUGH THE AIR BAG CUSHION MATERIAL, WHICH MAY RESULT IN INJURY OR DEATH TO VEHICLE OCCUPANTS.   REMEDY:    DEALERS WILL REPLACE THE FRONT PASSENGER AIR BAG INFLATOR, FREE OF CHARGE.   RECALL STATUS:  RECALL INCOMPLETE. REMEDY NOT YET AVAILABLE      1.5 YEARS LATER AND STILL NO REMEDY AVAILABLE?  IS THIS ONE PART OF THE TAKATA RECALL THAT I JUST SAW ON THE NBC NEWS?

TAKATA RECALL: DEALER HAS NO IDEA WHEN REPLACEMENT AIR BAGS WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR DEFECTIVE PASSENGER AIR BAG. I HAVE REQUESTED WHEN TO EXPECT RESOLUTION OF TWO DIFFERENT DEALERSHIPS IN THE LAST 12 MONTHS. NO ONE CAN GIVE ME ANY TIMELINE. I HAVE BEEN DRIVING THIS VEHICLE SINCE NEW (10 YEARS). IT WOULD BE NICE TO HAVE SOME IDEA OF WHEN I CAN EXPECT TO DRIVE A SAFE VEHICLE THAT WON'T BLOW UP IN MY FACE.

RECEIVED RECALL #15438 (NHTSA CAMPAIGN ID # 15V324) FROM GMC ON JULY 2015. CONTACTED GMC ON 28 SEP 2016 AND GMC ADVISED PARTS FOR CORRECTIVE FIX ARE NOT AVAILABLE AND ON BACK ORDER. 1 YEAR AND 2 MONTHS IS EXCESSIVE AND PARTS SHOULD BE MADE AVAILABLE ASAP.

TAKATA RECALL, IT HAS BEEN OVER 1 YEAR SINCE ORIGINAL NOTIFICATION OF RECALL. CONTACTED GM AND THEY STATE THE RECALL HAS NOT BEEN ACTIVATED YET AND THEY DO NOT HAVE AN EXPECTED START DATE. I FEEL THIS IS AN EXCESSIVE AMOUNT OF TIME TO CORRECT A SAFETY ISSUE.
ABS MODULE IS NO LONGER WORKING AND GM IS NO LONGER SUPPLYING THE PART AND NONE ARE AVAILABLE. TALKED TO REPAIR SHOPS AND IT ISN'T A FIXABLE PART LEAVING THE TRUCK WITHOUT ABS.

ON OCT. 12, 20115, WHILE DRIVING ON A STATE HIGHWAY TO THE GROCERY STORE, AS I WAS SLOWING DOWN FOR A RED LIGHT THE PASSENGER SIDE REAR BRAKE LINE RUPTURED.  TO MAKE A LONG STORY SHORT, I PURCHASED A NEW BRAKE LINE AND REPLACED IT. I ALSO HAD TO REPLACE THE CALIPER BECAUSE OF CORROSION. DURING THE REPLACEMENT OF THE BRAKE LINE I INSPECTED THE OTHER BRAKE LINES. THEY WERE ALSO RUSTY.  I CALLED MY SERVICE CENTER AND THEY TOLD ME IT'S A RESULT OF THE PRE-TREATMENT SOLUTION THEY SPRAY ON THE ROADS IN THE WINTER.   ON JANUARY 11TH OF THIS YEAR, A SECOND BRAKE LINE RUPTURED WHEN A CAR PULLED OUT RIGHT IN FRONT OF ME ON THE SAME ROAD AS BEFORE. THIS TIME IT WAS THE BRAKE LINE THAT RUNS FROM THE MASTER CYLINDER TO THE ABS MODULE.   I PURCHASED THIS  2007 GMC SIERRA 2500HD BRAND NEW IN NOV OF 07'. IT HAS 17,510 ORIGINAL MILES. I WASH THE UNDER CARRIAGE EVERY SPRING AS I HAVE ON ALL MY PREVIOUS VEHICLES. MY FIRST CHEV. PICKUP I HAD FOR 20 YEARS AND NEVER HAD A BRAKE LINE ISSUE!!    WHEN I TALKED TO THE SERVICE MANAGER WHERE I HAVE MY VEHICLES SERVICED HE TOLD ME THEY ARE SEEING A LOT OF PICKUPS COMING IN WITH SIMILAR ISSUES. HE TOLD ME THAT THEY ARE INSTALLING THE NEW COPPER/ ZINC BRAKE LINES WHICH RESIST THE ROAD TREATMENTS. WHEN I ASKED IF THERE'S A CHARGE HE SAID FOR JUST REPLACING THE BRAKE LINES IT WOULD BE $1,500. BEING RETIRED ON A FIXED INCOME I CANNOT AFFORD ANYWHERE NEAR THAT MUCH!  BEING THIS IS A SERIOUS SAFETY ISSUE I FEEL GMC SHOULD RECALL AND REPLACE THESE INFERIOR BRAKE LINES. I CALLED GM TO ASK FOR HELP. THEY TOLD ME THE ONLY THING THEY COULD DO IS, BEING A LOYAL CUSTOMER, THEY WOULD GIVE ME $2,000 OFF A NEW TRUCK IF I WANTED TO TRADE IT IN. MY RESPONSE: WHY WOULD I TRADE IN A TRUCK THAT'S BOUGHT AND PAID FOR WITH ONLY 17,510 MILES ON IT AND IN EXCELLENT CONDITION OTHERWISE FOR ANOTHER NEW TRUCK AND ANOTHER 6 YEARS OF PAYMENTS THAT WE CANNOT AFFORD! PLEASE HELP.
2007 GMC SIERRA 2500.  CONSUMER WRITES IN REGARDS TO REPLACEMENT PARTS NOT AVAILABLE TO REPAIR PASSENGER SIDE AIRBAG RECALL.  CONSUMER HAS ANOTHER VEHICLE COMPLAINT IN ARTEMIS.  *SMD

MY TRUCK HAS A FAULTY DASHBOARD AND IT IS A SAFETY CONCERN IF I GET IN AN ACCIDENT.  *TR

GENERAL MOTORS GMC SIERRA DURAMAX EQUIPPED PICK UP TRUCKS (LMM SERIES) HAVE AN ISSUE WITH LEAKING TRANSMISSION COOLING LINES WHERE THE RUBBER HOSES ARE CRIMPED TO THE STEEL CONNECTORS. THE PROBLEM IS A FIRE HAZARD DUE TO LEAKING TRANSMISSION FLUID. GM HAS ALREADY ISSUED REPLACEMENT OF THESE HOSES FOR THE 2008 MODEL YEAR. IN 2007 GM HAD A SPLIT YEAR OFFERING FOR THE DURAMAX. THE 2007 VERSION WAS A SERIES LBZ. IN THE SECOND HALF OF 2007 (DUE TO EMISSIONS REQUIREMENTS) GMC INTRODUCED THE MODEL YEAR DESIGNATION 2007.5. THE 2007.5 WERE THE FIRST OF THE LMM SERIES. THE 2007.5 ARE IDENTICAL TO MODEL YEAR 2008.     THE 2007.5 LMM SERIES HAVE THE SAME LEAKING TRANSMISSION COOLER  LINES AND SHOULD BE INCLUDED IN THE SAME DECISION AS THE 2008 MODELS. SINCE THE 2007.5 SHOW UP AS "2007" MODEL YEAR THEY HAVE NOT BEEN INCLUDED. GM HAS MISSED THIS SMALL GROUP OF 1/2 YEAR VEHICLES (I BELIEVE AN OVERSIGHT) IN THE HOSE REPLACE RECALL. SINCE THIS ISSUE HAS ALREADY BEEN IDENTIFIED FOR 2008 VEHICLES THE SAME ISSUE APPLIES FOR 2007.5 MODELS. THEY SHOULD ALSO BE INCLUDED BUT CURRENTLY ARE NOT. I'M HOPING THAT THE AWARENESS OF THE UNUSUAL SPLIT YEAR MODELS (SERIES LMM) IS REALIZED AND THEIR VIN NUMBERS ADDED TO THE RECALL.    *TR

I OWN A 2007 GMC SIERRA 2500HD PICKUP WITH 94278 MILES ON IT. THIS WEEK END THE RIGHT FRONT  WHEEL BEARING ASSY FAILED FOR THE SECOND TIME, AND THE LEFT ONE WAS ON ITS WAY TO FAILING. AT A COST OF 375.00 EACH I REPLACED BOTH SIDES. THIS SEEMS VERY EXCESSIVE TO ME TO HAVE TO REPLACE THE WHEEL BEARINGS FOR THE SECOND TIME WITH LESS THAN ONE HUNDRED THOUSAND MILES ON THE VEHICLE.  *TR
I HAD TO REPLACE A FUEL LINE LAST FALL BECAUSE IT RUSTED THRU.. ON JUNE 6 2014 I NOTICED FUEL DRIPPING FROM THE FENDER EDGE WHICH WAS FOUND TO BE A FUEL LEAK FROM A LINE ON TOP THE TANK.  *TR

THE CONTACT STATED THAT ALL OF THE ELECTRICAL COMPONENTS IN THE VEHICLE FAILED FOR APPROXIMATELY 10 MINUTES BEFORE FUNCTIONING PROPERLY. THE VEHICLE WAS NOT TAKEN TO THE DEALER FOR INSPECTION OR REPAIRS. THE MANUFACTURER WAS NOTIFIED BUT PROVIDED NO ASSISTANCE. THE FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 133,000.

TRUCK WAS TRAVELING APPROXIMATELY AT FIFTY OR FIFTY FIVE, SUDDENLY DRIVER LOST CONTROL OF VEHICLE, WENT OFF THE ROAD AND LANDED IN TREES AND BUSHES,  NONE OF THE AIR BAGS DEPLOYED, THERE WERE THREE PASSENGERS.        *JS

I HAVE A 2007 GMC SIERRA 2500 HD CREW CAB SLT PICKUP 4D 6  FT., PURCHASED NEW IN O7, WITH ABOUT 70,000 MILES ON IT.  I JUST HAD THE RIGHT FRONT AXLE COME APART. IT SEEMS THE RUBBER BOOT AND TWO METAL BANDS THAT CLAMP THE BOOT ONTO BOTH PARTS OF THE AXLE HOLD THE AXLE TOGETHER.  *TR

GMC-CHEVROLET PICKUP TRUCKS, YEAR 2000 TO CURRENT.  BRAKE ROTORS DELAMINATING AND RUSTING, CAUSING BRAKE DISC PADS NOT TO GRIP THE ROTOR.  FREQUENT PROBLEM CAUSING BRAKES TO WORK POORLY. GMC REFUSES TO REPLACE POOR QUALITY BRAKE ROTORS EVEN UNDER NEW CAR WARRANTY. SERIOUS DECAY IN BRAKING FROM HIGH SPEED, TOWING OR WITH LOADS IN THE TRUCK.  DEALER ADMITS PROBLEM, FACTORY REFUSES TO FIX.  AFTERMARKET ROTORS BY EBC WORK PROPERLY FOR SAFETY IN STOPPING.  AC DELCO ROTORS ARE SERIOUSLY DEFECTIVE.  NARROWLY AVOIDED AN ACCIDENT WITH POOR BRAKES ON A TRUCK 2 YEARS OLD WITH 13,000 MILES.  WELL KNOWN PROBLEM DISCUSSED AROUND THE INTERNET. *TR
CHROME PEELING FROM INTERIOR DOOR HANDLES ON 2007 GMC SIERRA PICK-UP.  COULD CUT HAND.  *TR

AS I WAS LEAVING LAS VEGAS ON I 15, I GOT A MESSAGE OF REDUCED POWER. I WAS JUST OUT  OF HEAVY TRAFFIC, TRAVELING ABOUT 70 MPH, WHEN THE ENGINE SLOWED TO ABOUT 1,000 RPM WITH OUT WARNING. FOUND OUT LATER THAT IT WAS A BROKEN LEAD WIRE TO THE THROTTLE POSITION SENSOR. THE TRUCK HAD ABOUT 37,000 MILES ONIT. THE TRUCK IS A 2007 2500HD WITH 6.0 ENGINE. THE TRUCKI HAS NEVER BEEN WORKED ON,AND IS LINE NEW. DEALER INSTALLED  P/N 88986255 CONNECTOR. I RECEIVED HALF OR THE COST BACK AFTER CALLING GMC. I FEEL THAT THIS IS A SAFETY PROBLEM. AS I WAS JUST OUT OF HEAVY TRAFFIC AND COULD PULL OFF OF THE ROAD. *TR

WENT TO RETAILER TO GET A FLAT REPAIRED - THEY TOLD ME IT WAS NOT REPAIRABLE ANDSOLD ME A USED TIRE. WITHIN 250 MILES AFTER PURCHASE THE TREAD SEPARATED - AND CAUSED DAMAGE TO MY TRUCK. NEITHER THE MANUFACTURER OF THE TIRE NOR THE RETAILER WOULD HELP WITH THE SUBSTANTIAL REPAIR COSTS. *TR

CHECK ENGINE LIGHT COMES ON AND ENGINES GOES INTO REDUCED POWER MODE.  DOESN'T HAVE ENOUGH POWER TO GO OVER 40 MPH.  WHILE PULLING A TRAILER THE ENGINE DOESN'T HAVE ENOUGH POWER TO CLIMB HILLS OR GO OVER 25 MPH.  I HAVE TAKEN TO DEALER TWICE AND THEY SAY GM IS AWARE OF THE PROBLEM BUT THEY DON'T HAVE A FIX FOR IT.  IT'S NOT SAFE HAVING A VEHICLE THAT BREAKS DOWN IN -15 DEGREE WEATHER AND HAVING THE DEALER TELL YOU THAT THERE IS NO FIX FOR THE PROBLEM AND TO JUST KEEP DRIVING THE VEHICLE. *TR

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 GMC SIERRA 2500.  ON TWO SEPARATE OCCASIONS WHILE DRIVING DOWNHILL AT 45 MPH, THE ROTORS BECAME WARPED AND BEGAN SMOKING.  THE CONTACT SMELLED A BURNING ODOR.  ON EACH OCCASION, THE DEALER COULD NOT FIND ANY FAILURES.  THE CONTACT WAS CONCERNED THAT HIS BRAKES WOULD FAIL WHILE DRIVING DOWN A HILL.  THE CURRENT MILEAGE WAS 24,000 AND FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 22,000.

TIRE PRESSURE RECOMMENDED TOO HIGH. I BOUGHT A NEW 2007 GMC SIERRA 2500HD DIESEL CREW CAB LONG BED. AND THE REQUIRED TIRE PRESSURE FRONT IS 60PSI. THE REQUIRED REAR IS 80 PSI. COLD. THE DIAGNOSTICS ON DASH WARN YOU WHEN THE PRESSURE IS HIGH OR LOW BY 2LBS. THE PART THAT BOTHERS ME IS I PRIMARILY DRIVE THE TRUCK EMPTY AND IT IS VERY SQUIRRELLY AND HARD RIDING WHEN EMPTY AND TIRES AT 80 PSI. ESPECIALLY IN WET WEATHER. THE OTHER THING THAT BOTHERS ME IS THE TIRES ARE SIZE 245 75 R 16 E DESIGNED FOR NO MORE THAN 80 PSI COLD. THERE IS NO ROOM TO ALLOW LOWERING TIRE TO A SAFE PRESSURE WHEN TRUCK IS EMPTY. THE ONLY OTHER SOLUTION IS TO ADD WEIGHT TO THE BED OF THE TRUCK TO PUT TRACTION TO REAR TIRES AND I DON'T THINK THAT IS REALISTIC. BEFORE SOMEONE HAS AN ACCIDENT TRYING TO OBEY THE LABEL MAYBE THIS LABEL AND DIAGNOSTICS SHOULD BE CHANGED.  *TR
USE OF ULTRA LOW SULFUR DIESEL FUEL CAUSING DAMAGE IN EARLIER DIESEL ENGINES.  *TR

2007 GMC SIERRA IS BLOWING EXTREMELY HOT AIR BUT IT WILL NOT CLEAR ICE FROM WINDOW. CONSUMER STATES THAT THE AIR IS SO HOT IT BURNS AND YOU CAN'T PLACE YOUR HAND ON THE DASH BECAUSE IT IS THAT HOT. BUT HE SAYS IT WILL NOT DEFROST THE WINDOW.  *KB  THE CONSUMER STATED THE DEFROSTER DID NOT DEFROST THE UPPER PART OF THE WINDSHIELD, ONLY THE LOWER PART. *JB

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 GMC SIERRA 2500.  WHILE DRIVING 5 MPH, THE RECEIVER PART OF THE HITCH SEPARATED AND FELL TO THE GROUND WITH THE TRAILER ATTACHED.  THE TRAILER HITCH HAS TO BE REPLACED.  THE CURRENT MILEAGE IS 1,600 AND FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 1,400.

TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 GMC SIERRA 2500.  THE CONTACT STATED THAT THE VEHICLE'S COOLANT IS CONSTANTLY LOW.  THE WARNING LIGHT INDICATED A LOW COOLANT LEVEL.  THE DEALER DIAGNOSED THE CAUSE OF FAILURE AS THE O RING MISSING FROM THE FLY WHEEL HOUSING COOLANT.  THE DEALER REPAIRED THE VEHICLE, HOWEVER, THE LOW OIL INDICATOR LIGHT ILLUMINATED.  THE DEALER DIAGNOSED THE CAUSE OF FAILURE AS AN OIL FILTER LEAK.  THE SEALS AND OIL FILTER WERE REPLACED.  WHEN THE CONTACT PICKED UP THE VEHICLE, HE NOTICED AN OIL LEAK.  THE VEHICLE HAS NOT BEEN REPAIRED.  THE CURRENT MILEAGE IS 4,000 AND FAILURE MILEAGE WAS 650.
